DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason a survey is not complete.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.

Concepts.definition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.

Property.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The reason a survey is not complete.

PermissibleValues.value: Survey Not Started. Staff unable to administer, e.g wrong language, specify:
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Survey Negation Begin Staff Unable to Do Administer For Example Wrong Language Specify

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Survey Negation Begin Staff Unable to Do Administer For Example Wrong Language Specify
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.: The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.: A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.: To dispense, apply, or tender something to another, such as administering a medicine.: The reason of something.: A representative form or pattern; an item of information that is representative of a type.: Not accurate, correct, or appropriate.: A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.: Be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.
A response indicating that an individual is unable to do something.
To dispense, apply, or tender something to another, such as administering a medicine.
The reason of something.
A representative form or pattern; an item of information that is representative of a type.
Not accurate, correct, or appropriate.
A systematic means of communicating by the use of sounds, symbols, or gestures.
Be specific about something; define clearly.

PermissibleValues.value: Survey Incomplete. Patient ran out of time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Not meeting a quantitative or qualitative measure necessary for a requirement.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

PermissibleValues.value: Survey Incomplete. Patient refusal: patient reported physical reason, including fatigue
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Survey Incomplete Patient Refuse Patient-Reported Physical Reason Include Fatigue

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Survey Incomplete Patient Refuse Patient-Reported Physical Reason Include Fatigue
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.: An indication that the patient provides information about their vital signs, status, or subjective feelings. Some systems also consider information reported by the patient's family or guardian as patient-reported.: Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.: Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.: Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

Concepts.definition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

An indication that the patient provides information about their vital signs, status, or subjective feelings. Some systems also consider information reported by the patient's family or guardian as patient-reported.
Having substance or material existence; concerned with material things; of or pertaining to the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.
Overall tiredness and lack of energy.

PermissibleValues.value: Survey Incomplete. Patient refusal: patient reported mental/emotional reason, including stress
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Survey Incomplete Patient Refuse Patient-Reported Mental Health Emotional Reason Include Stress

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Survey Incomplete Patient Refuse Patient-Reported Mental Health Emotional Reason Include Stress
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.: Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.: An indication that the patient provides information about their vital signs, status, or subjective feelings. Some systems also consider information reported by the patient's family or guardian as patient-reported.: The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution.: Excessively affected by emotion.: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.: Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.: the biological response to noxious, demanding, or unpleasant stimuli or conditions; do not confuse stress with STRESSOR, which is the stimulus.

Concepts.definition: A document used in a method of data collection that involves interviewing (or giving questionnaires to) a representative and often large group of people.
Not whole; lacking some necessary part or detail; unfinished.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

An indication that the patient provides information about their vital signs, status, or subjective feelings. Some systems also consider information reported by the patient's family or guardian as patient-reported.
The overall state of an individual's psychologic constitution.
Excessively affected by emotion.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
Add as part of something else; put in as part of a set, group, or category.
The negative mental, emotional, and physical reactions that occur when environmental stressors are perceived as exceeding the individual's adaptive capacities.

PermissibleValues.value: Not within 4 weeks prior to the start of the preparative regimen
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Negation Within 4 Week Prior Begin Preparative Regimen

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Negation Within 4 Week Prior Begin Preparative Regimen
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: On the inside; contained in.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::4: Any period of seven consecutive days.: Earlier in time or order.: Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
On the inside; contained in.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
Earlier in time or order.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.

The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.

PermissibleValues.value: Recipient no longer met substudy eligibility criteria
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recipient Current Did Not Meet Eligibility Criteria Clinical Study Population Subgroup

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recipient Current Did Not Meet Eligibility Criteria Clinical Study Population Subgroup
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who gets something.: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.: An indication that the subject has not fulfilled the criteria needed to continue to the next study period.: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.

Concepts.definition: A person who gets something.
Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
An indication that the subject has not fulfilled the criteria needed to continue to the next study period.

Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
